00031 // This function will be called by HGE once per frame.
00032 // Put your game loop code here. In this example we
00033 bool BaseFrameFunc()
00034 {
00035     return SystemManager::get()->FrameFunc();
00036 }
00037 
00038 bool BaseRenderFunc()
00039 {
00040     SystemManager::get()->RenderFunc();
00041     return false;
00042 }

00044 SystemManager* SystemManager::manager(NULL);

00046 SystemManager::SystemManager() : hge(NULL), currentState(NULL), changeStateNextFrame(false), changeStateTo(""), quitNextFrame(false), printKeyDown(false)
00047 {
00048     Utils::get()->writeToLog("Log initialized.");
00049     Utils::get()->writeToLog("Created general utilities.");
00050 
00051     TimerManager::get();
00052     Utils::get()->writeToLog("Created timer manager.");
00053 
00054     ScriptManager::get();
00055     Utils::get()->writeToLog("Created script manager.");
00056 
00057     SceneManager::get()->registerComponentType("SimpleRenderable", new SimpleRenderableCreator());
00058     SceneManager::get()->registerComponentType("LineRenderable", new LineRenderableCreator());
00059     SceneManager::get()->registerComponentType("CompoundRenderable", new CompoundRenderableCreator());
00060     SceneManager::get()->registerComponentType("TextRenderable", new TextRenderableCreator());
00061     SceneManager::get()->registerComponentType("TriangleRenderable", new TriangleRenderableCreator());
00062 
00063     Utils::get()->writeToLog("Creating scene manager.");
00064     InputManager::get();
00065     Utils::get()->writeToLog("Created input manager.");
00066     GuiManager::get();
00067     Utils::get()->writeToLog("Created gui manager.");
00068     RenderTextureManager::get();
00069     Utils::get()->writeToLog("Created render texture manager.");
00070 
00071     // Here we use global pointer to HGE interface.
00072     // Instead you may use hgeCreate() every
00073     // time you need access to HGE. Just be sure to
00074     // have a corresponding hge->Release()
00075     // for each call to hgeCreate()
00076     hge = HGE::hgeCreate(HGE_VERSION);
00077     if (hge == NULL)
00078         Utils::get()->writeToLog("Error creating HGE object.");
00079 }

00081 void SystemManager::start(const string& initialState, const string& windowTitle)
00082 {
00083 
00084     // Set the window title
00085     hge->System_SetState(HGE_TITLE, windowTitle.c_str());
00086 
00087     // Run in windowed mode
00088     // Default window size is 800x600
00089     hge->System_SetState(HGE_WINDOWED, true);
00090     hge->System_SetState(HGE_SCREENWIDTH, 800);
00091     hge->System_SetState(HGE_SCREENHEIGHT, 600);
00092     hge->System_SetState(HGE_SCREENBPP, 32);
00093 
00094     hge->System_SetState(HGE_LOGFILE, "HGE Log.txt");
00095     hge->System_SetState(HGE_USESOUND, false);
00096 
00097     hge->System_SetState(HGE_FPS, 60);
00098     hge->System_SetState(HGE_ZBUFFER, true);
00099     hge->System_SetState(HGE_SHOWSPLASH,false);
00100 
00101     // Set our frame function
00102     hge->System_SetState(HGE_FRAMEFUNC, BaseFrameFunc);
00103     //Set the render function
00104     hge->System_SetState(HGE_RENDERFUNC, BaseRenderFunc);
00105 
00106     // Tries to initiate HGE with the states set.
00107     // If something goes wrong, "false" is returned
00108     // and more specific description of what have
00109     // happened can be read with System_GetErrorMessage().
00110 
00111     ScriptManager::get()->addBindings(new UtilBinder());
00112 
00113     if (hge->System_Initiate())
00114     {
00115         hge->System_Initiate();
00116 
00117         GuiManager::get()->initialize();
00118         changeState(initialState);
00119 
00120         hge->System_Start();
00121     }
00122     else
00123     {
00124         // If HGE initialization failed show error message
00125         MessageBox(NULL, hge->System_GetErrorMessage(), "Error", MB_OK | MB_ICONERROR | MB_APPLMODAL);
00126     }
00127 }

00129 void SystemManager::takeScreenshot(const string& fileName)
00130 {
00131     hge->System_Snapshot(fileName.c_str());
00132 }

00134 SystemManager::~SystemManager()
00135 {
00136     map<string, SystemState*>::iterator iter;
00137     for (iter= systemStates.begin(); iter != systemStates.end(); ++iter)
00138     {
00139         SystemState* tmp = iter->second;
00140         delete tmp;
00141     }
00142     systemStates.clear();
00143 
00144     delete ScriptManager::get();
00145     delete GuiManager::get();
00146     delete InputManager::get();
00147     delete RenderTextureManager::get();
00148     delete Utils::get();
00149     delete SceneManager::get();
00150     manager = NULL;
00151 
00152     // Release the HGE interface.
00153     // If there are no more references,
00154     // the HGE object will be deleted.
00155     hge->Release();
00156 
00157     // Restore video mode and free
00158     // all allocated resources
00159     hge->System_Shutdown();
00160 }

00162 SystemState* SystemManager::getCurrentState()
00163 {
00164     return currentState;
00165 }

00167 void SystemManager::addSystemState(SystemState* state)
00168 {
00169     map<string, SystemState*>::iterator iter;
00170     for (iter = systemStates.begin(); iter != systemStates.end(); ++iter)
00171     {
00172         if (iter->second == state)
00173         {
00174             Utils::get()->writeToLog("An instance of the [" + state->getName() + "] state already exists, ignoring.");
00175             return;
00176         }
00177     }
00178 
00179     systemStates[state->getName()] = state;
00180 }
00181 
00182 void SystemManager::changeState(const string newState)
00183 {
00184     if (systemStates.find(newState) != systemStates.end())
00185     {
00186         GuiManager::get()->clear();
00187         if (currentState != NULL)
00188             currentState->clear();
00189 
00190         TimerManager::get()->clearTimers();
00191 
00192         changeStateNextFrame = false;
00193         changeStateTo = "";
00194 
00195         currentState = systemStates[newState];
00196         currentState->createScene();
00197         Utils::get()->writeToLog("Switching SystemState to: " + newState + ".");
00198     }
00199     else
00200         Utils::get()->writeToLog("No SystemState named " + newState + " exists, ignoring.");
00201 }
00202 
00203 void SystemManager::changeStateNextUpdate(const string state)
00204 {
00205     changeStateNextFrame = true;
00206     changeStateTo = state;
00207 }
00208 
00209 void SystemManager::quitNextUpdate()
00210 {
00211     quitNextFrame = true;
00212 }
00213 
00214 bool SystemManager::FrameFunc()
00215 {
00216     if (quitNextFrame)
00217         return true;
00218     if (changeStateNextFrame)
00219     {
00220         changeStateNextFrame = false;
00221         changeState(changeStateTo);
00222     }
00223 
00224     if (hge->Input_GetKey() == HGEK_PAUSE && !printKeyDown)
00225         takeScreenshot("screen shot.png");
00226 
00227     if (hge->Input_GetKey() == HGEK_PAUSE)
00228         printKeyDown = true;
00229     else
00230         printKeyDown = false;
00231 
00232     if (currentState != NULL)
00233     {
00234         TimerManager::get()->update();
00235         if (hge->Input_KeyDown(HGEK_COMMA))
00236             GuiManager::get()->getConsole()->setVisible(!GuiManager::get()->getConsole()->isVisible());
00237         GuiManager::get()->update();
00238         currentState->FrameFunc();
00239     }
00240 
00241     return false;
00242 }
00243 
00244 void SystemManager::RenderFunc()
00245 {
00246     if (currentState != NULL)
00247     {
00248         hge->Gfx_BeginScene();
00249         hge->Gfx_Clear(0);
00250 
00251         SceneManager::get()->render();
00252         GuiManager::get()->render();
00253         hge->Gfx_EndScene();
00254     }
00255 }

00272 SystemManager* SystemManager::get()
00273 {
00274     if (manager == NULL)
00275         manager = new SystemManager();
00276 
00277     return manager;
